abstract: In celebration of Blahnik's 40th anniversary, a tribute exhibition and sale of some of his most iconic styles.
lead_paragraph: "Oh yes, this shoe was specially made for Anna Piaggi in the '70s, and this one for J. Lo when she was still Jenny From the Block. Rihanna just bought a heap of those so they must be coming back," says the shoe designer Manolo Blahnik in reference to the striped cutout sandals and the lace-up Timberland-like boots, respectively, that will soon be available once again as part of a tribute exhibition at Lane Crawford in Hong Kong. Through March, in celebration of Blahnik's 40th anniversary, 10 iconic styles - this Alexander Calder-inspired flat called "Tuberose" from 1981 among them - will be sold in a gallery shop filled with Manolo memorabilia. "I don't know years when it comes to my archives," Blahnik says. "For me, they each have a special time and place, but in fashion they're always now."

headline.main: From the Archives | Manolo Blahnik at Lane Crawford
